I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. Some people may disagree with me on this title, saying that the story is way to hateful to be enjoyable and that the characters do not grow, but they miss a vital point: in his first film, Blier puts the finger on an elephant in the room: men. A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat-loving witch (Debbie Reynolds). The title of the film refers to the character played by Krige. Well, it does sort of remind me of Fatal Attraction.
